intro: Myxopyrum smilacifolium subsp. confertum, commonly known as the denseleaf smilacifolium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its dense, narrow leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Its flowers are small and greenish, typically clustered in inflorescences at the base of the plant. This subspecies is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
